title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Friday 7 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: police car girl crash : officer 'driving below expected standard ' .
pcc survives vote of no confidence .
mother jailed for sex with teen .
person 'has life-changing injuries ' after lorry-car crash .
row over who should pay £ 26m worth of hospital repairs .
driver trapped after vehicle leaves road , hits lamp-post and crashes into wall .
plymouth sex assault : cctv images released by police .
dogs caught by fire staff reunited with owner .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday 10 july 2017 .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on monday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night , and over the weekend on your bbc local radio station .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: famous gardeners create space in cornwall
text: a family with an esteemed gardening reputation , has now created a fantasy garden in cornwall .
isabel and julian bannerman have designed for prince charles at highgrove and lord rothschild .
this latest creation is at trematon castle near saltash .
really looking forward to @ twitterid @ twitterid film of beautiful # trematon castle nr saltash , home of isabel & julian bannerman

documents.title: police and crime commissioner pledges to keep working to keep communities safe
text: cornwall 's police and crime commissioner has vowed to continue working to keep communities safe , after surviving a vote of no confidence by the body which scrutinises her .
alison hernandez came under fire last month for suggesting gun owners might be able to act as armed civilians in a terror attack .
the comments , made during a bbc radio cornwall phone in prompted the devon and cornwall police and crime panel to hold the ballot at its meeting this lunchtime .
what i do is i present the views of the public .
that is my job .
i 'm not supposed to be popular with that .
i 'm supposed to understand the public and bring those views into policing to think about how we can do things differently .
we all need to keep ourselves safe and the public have a role to play in that .

documents.title: new crossing for students
text: a new pedestrian crossing has been installed between mabe , the university campus at penryn and the surrounding area .
the new crossing will allow for the safe crossing of pedestrians on a popular shortcut from mabe to the schools in penryn and the university campus .
the works have been jointly funded by cornwall council and the university of exeter and falmouth university .

the university of exeter and falmouth university provided £ 25,000 for the works and an additional £ 9,000 of funds were made available through cornwall council section 106 monies , arising from new developments within the area .

documents.title: rogue traders rife in cornwall
text: almost £ 250,000 has been paid to rogue traders in cornwall since april .
cornwall trading standards says it 's received a report every other day for the past three months .
leanne mclean from trading standards told bbc radio cornwall they 're concerned the actual figure could be higher , because only one in 10 victims reports a scam .
she said : `` we 've had reports of tarmaccers targeting schools and businesses as well as home owners , roofing , dry-verging , tree surgery , landscaping , block paving .
`` it 's such good weather down here , it 's prefect for ripping people off if that 's the game that you 're in . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: bodmin moor 's dark skies recognised
text: bodmin moor has been designated an international dark sky landscape , making it the first international dark sky place in an area of outstanding natural beauty ( aonb ) .

following a bid by cornwall council and caradon observatory , the international dark-sky association ( ida ) has awarded the designation in recognition of the exceptional quality of the night sky over bodmin moor .
it also recognises commitments to avoid light pollution and the provision of educational outreach .

`` while other sites in the uk have previously received international dark sky places accreditation , today 's announcement of bodmin moor 's status as an international dark sky park is especially noteworthy , '' said ida executive director j. scott feierabend .

he continued : `` its position within the cornwall aonb clearly establishes that the conservation of dark night skies is wholly compatible with the notion of protected landscapes where people routinely live and work . ''

documents.title: dark sky reward for bodmin moor
text: bodmin moor has been recognised as an international dark sky landscape .
the main purpose of the designation is to protect the quality of the sky over the moor .
it becomes the fourth dark sky park in the uk , and the 44th in the world .

bob egerton , cornwall councillor for planning and economy said : `` it gives man a sense of perspective when you look up at the night sky and realise how big it is up there and how small we are in comparison . ''

documents.title: dartmoor safety day
text: tomorrow is safety on dartmoor day which is being held at lydford sports field .
come along and meet some of the team !
a fine body of men and women !

documents.title: a30 fraddon fire reported by over 50 people was sparked by cigarette butt claims eyewitness
text: a fire on the a30 near fraddon was sparked by a discarded cigarette butt , an eyewitness has claimed .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: police driver has 'no case for misconduct '
text: the police officer who collided with a 12-year-old girl while driving to an emergency response , will not face a misconduct hearing .
the officer was driving at 35mph when the marked ford focus hit the girl , causing serious head injuries for which she is still receiving treatment .
an investigation by the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) found the car did not have its sidelights on as it should have .
the incident happened at 08:00 in january 2016 .
the lead investigator initially recommended the driver should face misconduct proceedings , but changed its view following feedback from devon and cornwall police .
ipcc commissioner cindy butts said : `` the officer 's driving fell below the level of performance expected when assessed against the force 's policy .

`` i accepted the force 's determination that the officer should face management action which included a three-month performance plan to ensure that lessons are learned from this unfortunate accident . ''

documents.title: airport figures rise again
text: passenger numbers at cornwall airport newquay are continuing to rise .
the latest figures show a 20 % year on year increase for june , meaning there 's been a 26 % rise for the first quarter of the financial year .
geoff brown , cabinet member for transport at cornwall council added : `` this is great news and a huge tribute to the dedication and hard work of the airport team .
`` not only has the council been able to lift the passenger surcharge but we have also reduced the levy paid to maintain the airport operations .

`` in addition to the benefits to residents travelling away , cornwall airport newquay also attracts significant tourism business in to cornwall which helps generate significant growth in the local economy . ''

documents.title: travel : a35 reopened
text: all lanes open / collision clrd # a35 both ways btwn # honiton + # kilmington .
traffic flowing .
slight delay but clearing .
have a safe journey

documents.title: ​schoolboy caused serious crash just days after passing his test
text: a schoolboy who caused a serious accident just days after passing his test has been banned from driving .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: weather : some bright spells and light winds
text: for the rest of the day cloud will thicken in places and it will feel fresher too than yesterday .
there will be some bright spells and light winds , and it should stay dry .
maximum temperature : 23c ( 73f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: 'ill-judged ' gun comment sparked no confidence vote
text: the police and crime commissioner for devon and cornwall has survived a vote of no confidence by the body that scrutinises her .
alison hernandez came under fire after she said she would consider letting gun owners act during a terror attack .
on bbc radio cornwall in june she said `` people would do all sorts of things to try and save their community without even thinking '' .
earlier this week plymouth city council passed a vote of no confidence over the issue .
today the devon and cornwall police and crime panel also held a no confidence vote , proposed by plymouth councillor sam davey , who said the comments were `` ill-judged '' .
ms hernandez said : `` the reality is i do not believe in vigilantism .
i apologise if anyone felt i had a different view . ''
the no confidence vote was defeated by eight votes to two .
author: John Henderson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: travel : diversion near kilmington after crash
text: travel : diversion near kilmington after crash
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: woman 's plea to 'let me die at home ' after telehealth scheme cancelled
text: a scheme to help keep people with long term illnesses out of hospital is being ditched to save money by cash-strapped health bosses in cornwall .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: police officer 'driving below expected standard '
text: a police officer whose car collided with a 12-year-old girl in camborne last year was driving below the expected standards , a report has found .
the independent police complaints commission ( ipcc ) investigation was looking into the incident in january 2016 in trevenson street .
it said : `` it has been agreed with devon and cornwall police the driving of an officer fell below the standards set out in force policy . ''
the girl sustained serious head injuries and has since made a significant recovery , but is still receiving medical treatment .
the report found the car , which was responding to an emergency , was travelling at 35mph when it hit her .
it said she would have been visible to the driver from around 75 metres away .
evidence gathered during the ipcc investigation showed the car 's blue flashing lights were illuminated but the sidelights , siren and headlights were not on .

documents.title: breakingreport into police car girl crash
text: a police officer that was driving a force car that crashed into a 12-year-old girl in camborne , was driving below the standards expected , the independent police complaints commission has said .
it happened in 2016 and the girl sustained serious head injuries .
more to follow .

documents.title: fish tank heater fire tackled
text: firefighters have tackled a fish tank heater and skirting board fire in teignmouth .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service was called to orchard gardens at 04:00 .
when fire crews arrived , they said they could smell burning , but there were no obvious signs of fire .
firefighters put out the small fire which involved the heater and boards .

documents.title: person airlifted to hospital after serious lorry-car crash
text: the devon air ambulance has airlifted one person to hospital after a serious accident in axminster between a lorry and a car .
the crash happened on the a35 near shute earlier today .
the road remains closed in both directions .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: can you name this fish ?
text: caught 10mins ago 5miles out of falmouth .
what on earth is it ?
what this weird fish is - caught off falmouth @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid
thank you .
are they common as i 've never seen anything quite like it
its a red band fish
fairly common off cornwall , but rarely seen .
has burrows in seabed , often below 50 fathoms mark .
is it a very thin gurnard
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid i think it 's a ribbon fish .
a deadfish ?

documents.title: airport figures taking off
text: there 's been a 20 % increase in the number of passengers using cornwall airport newquay .
figures show that 50,993 used the airport in june .

al titterington , managing director , said : `` i 'd take a 26 % growth in any circumstances and be happy with our start to the summer season , but when you consider that is on top of over 50 % growth in the last financial year , a year when we were the fastest growing airport in the uk , then it really starts to feel like our efforts are paying off .

`` despite a more challenging operating environment our business strategy remains the same , to continue to expand our route network and increase our year-round services and we 'll continue to work to strengthen our relationships with our airline partners in an attempt to keep achieving these results . ''
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: pcc alison hernandez survives vote of no confidence by crime panel
text: devon and cornwall 's police and crime commissioner alison hernandez has survived a vote of no confidence by a police and crime panel .
the panel of councillors and independent individuals was created in 2011 to scrutinise the work of police and crime commissioners ( pcc ) .
earlier in the week , ms hernandez said she was `` disappointed '' that plymouth city council passed a motion of no confidence in her .
author: John Henderson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: breakingpcc survives vote of no confidence
text: the region 's police and crime commissioner has `` comfortably survived '' a vote of no confidence by a police and crime panel .
the vote came after alison hernandez said she would consider letting gun owners act during a terror attack .
more to follow .
author: John Henderson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: no deputy for police commissioner
text: the police and crime panel has refused to appoint a deputy police and crime commissioner for devon , cornwall and isles of scilly .
the panel said mark kingscote `` does not meet minimum requirements of the post '' .
no other reasons were given but the decision is a blow to alison hernandez , the pcc who proposed mr kingscote .
author: John Henderson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: triple gull attack leaves woman , 84 , scarred for life
text: ann thirwell is counting the cost of an ice-cream on the seafront after a gull attack left her with a four-inch gash on her cheek .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: cornish businesses worried by brexit
text: three quarters of cornish businesses surveyed are concerned about uncertainty in the market caused by brexit .
the finding comes from the results of the quarterly economic survey , carried out by the cornwall chamber of commerce .
kim conchie , chief executive of cornwall chamber of commerce , said : the qes is the government 's insight into how businesses across the uk are feeling .
`` it is essential that we get a solid response from cornwall so that i can tell local government and our mps what is needed for us to flourish . ''

documents.title: duurrr dum , duuurrr dum , dur dum dur dum dur dum
text: if you have a fear of sharks , this may not be an event for you .
jaws , the famous film about a great white shark terrifying a coastal community is to be screened at the jubilee pool in penzance .
rafferty 's events has made the announcement on facebook , adding that wetsuits must be worn , and `` you will not want to go back into the water
watch this all time classic horror movie in the water for the ultimate experience . ''
it is also being shown at tinside lido in plymouth , as one of a series of outdoor screenings by plymouth arts centre .

documents.title: mother jailed for sex with teen
text: a mother has been jailed for having sex with a 15-year-old boy .
lindsey taylor , 42 , of tristan close , exeter , admitted sexual activity with a child and was jailed for two years by judge geoffrey mercer , qc , at exeter crown court .
he told her : `` however this came about , this was very , very wrong and you must have known that .
`` it happened after you had been drinking alcohol and smoking cannabis with him , and these are obvious aggravating factors .
`` what you did caused untold damage .
i have read the victim impact statement from the boy 's mother and understandably she feels sick about it . ''

documents.title: road cleared after coach-car crash
text: # cornwall at tresillian the b3275 is now clear after a collision involving a car and a coach at the a390 [ pl ]

documents.title: children in devon and cornwall have most firearms licences
text: more children aged under 18 in devon and cornwall have firearms licenses than any other part of england and wales .
figures from the home office show 216 children in the two counties have them , out of 3,602 nationally .
across all ages , devon and cornwall have the highest number of firearms certificates with 11,144 , followed by sussex ( 6,934 ) and north yorkshire ( 6,734 ) .
devon and cornwall police said : `` many people use firearms for their work or are involved in organised gun sport which are both important to the south west economy .

`` the force interrogates every new application or renewal to ensure only those individuals who are safe to own them and are no threat to themselves , other gun users or the general public , are granted licences . ''

documents.title: person 'has life-changing injuries ' after lorry-car crash
text: a person involved in a crash between a lorry and a car is believed to have life-changing arm injuries , police have said .
emergency services were called to the crash between a mazda saloon and a hgv lorry on the a35 near shute , axminster at 09:25 .
closures are in place both eastbound and westbound .
police are urging drivers to avoid the area .
the injured person will be flown to hospital by air ambulance shortly

documents.title: hospital maintenance backlog : 'time for excuses is over '
text: there is a dispute over who should pay for a £ 26m maintenance backlog at 11 of cornwall 's community hospitals .
they are owned by nhs property services but they are in dispute with the tenant , cornwall partnership nhs foundation trust , over who is responsible for the buildings ' conditions .
in the meantime , some beds remain closed at hospitals including fowey and edward hain in st ives .

andy virr , a & e consultant at the royal cornwall hospital and cornwall councillor for fowey said : `` these hospitals have been under a different ownership for the past five years , and maintenance has not been made a priority .
`` we know the government in its manifesto has pledged money for a large capital programme to reinvest in old nhs properties .
the time for excuses is over .
`` we need to be applying for government money .
we need to understand exactly what essential work needs to be done .

my concern is that this is another level of excuse to keep community hospitals closed as part of a long-term plan to reduce the number of community beds in cornwall which i do n't believe is credible . ''
nhs property services said it was `` determined to find a solution to these complex issues '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel : coach crash at tresillian
text: travel : coach crash at tresillian
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: dogs caught by fire staff reunited with owner
text: two dogs that were found by fire staff yesterday in cornwall , have been reunited with their owner .
the team at the fire service workshops found the animals near tolvaddon , and although they were micro-chipped , the registered phone number was not working .
cornwall fire and rescue service said : `` from speaking with the dog team it appears that they have been collected !
they have been removed from the stray dogs list which is a good sign .
thank you so much for the publicity it 's much appreciated and it seems to have worked as they now appear to be at home with the owner . ''

documents.title: dartington 'words ' festival begins
text: the `` ways with words '' literature festival starts today at dartington hall in devon .
the festival 's now in its 26th year and will run for the next 10 days .
during that time , there 'll be 130 events from talks and workshops to live music and literary debates .
this year , the poet simon armitage and novelist fay weldon will be attending , along with broadcasters joan bakewell , jonathan dimbleby and melvyn bragg .

documents.title: you never forget your first shout
text: a new firefighter had a memorable first emergency call out in newton abbot yesterday .
daniel harrity was part of the crew called to a cat stuck on a ledge on the side of the river lemon .
the animal was `` distressed '' , but the team managed to carry it away to safety .

documents.title: truro farmer calls for government action over tb
text: an award-winning dairy farm on the outskirts of truro has told of `` heartbreak '' after 36 cattle had to be slaughtered following a bovine tuberculosis ( tb ) outbreak .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: man airlifted to hospital after a380 crash
text: a man was airlifted to hospital after an accident on the a380 near kingskerswell in devon .
it happened on the exeter-bound carriageway at about 19:15 on thursday when one vehicle hit the verge .
police say the male driver was taken by air ambulance to derriford hospital in plymouth with pelvis and chest pain .
it is understood that the driver does not have life threatening or changing injuries .
the road was reopened at 03:00 .

documents.title: dodgy roofers warning near newquay
text: yesterday this warning was issued
warning rogue roofers in st columb today .
three males in an unmarked blue transit cold calling offerring dry verge caps .
do not contract

documents.title: woman 'severely injured ' after car leaves road and ends up in field
text: firefighters say a woman was left `` severely injured '' after a car left the road , overturned and ended up in a field on thursday night .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: weather : cloudier and cooler today
text: although there will still be some bright spells and sunny periods , in general it 'll be cloudier today with some mist and low cloud affecting hills and parts of the coast .
winds will be mainly light or moderate from the west or northwest .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: plymouth sex assault : cctv images released by police
text: devon and cornwall police have released three of a man they wish to identify in connection with a sexual assault in plymouth .
the incident happened at about 03:30 on tuesday 13 june at switch bar in sherwell arcade in plymouth .

documents.title: travel : kingsbridge road now open
text: between kingsbridge and loddiswell , the road has now reopened following a serious accident and investigation work overnight between the village centre and the bottom of the main hill towards kingsbridge .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: £ 50m research facility at university
text: the university of exeter 's goal to become one of the world 's leading research centres , has taken a big step forward with its new living systems institute .
the building cost about £ 50m and houses 200 researchers investigating everything from bio-science , to physics and engineering .
scientists are also looking for ways to tackle disease and improve human health at the new facility .
author: Adrian Campbell, Environment Correspondent
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: fantasy garden in saltash
text: isabel and julian bannerman are gardeners with an international reputation .
they 've designed green spaces for prince charles at highgrove and for lord rothschild at waddestone manor .
they are also responsible for creating the british 9/11 memorial in new york .
but they 've swapped some of their aristocratic clients to create their own fantasy garden at trematon castle near saltash .
full of sweet scented blooms , they aim to prove summer cornish gardens can be just as spectacular as spring ones .

documents.title: travel : road closed after serious accident
text: the road from kingsbridge to loddiswell remains closed between the village centre and the bottom of the main hill towards kingsbridge , due to a serious accident overnight .
diversions are in place through the lanes , but these are badly congested .
police are asking drivers to seek an alternative route
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: row over £ 26m worth of hospital maintenance
text: cornwall 's 11 nhs owned community hospitals have a maintenance backlog of £ 26m and there 's a row over who should pay .
it includes all of the county 's community hospitals , except for bodmin and liskeard which are provided through private finance initiatives .
nhs property services own the rest and is in a dispute with the tenant cornwall partnership nhs foundation trust , over who is responsible for the buildings ' conditions .
in the meantime , some beds remain closed at hospitals such as edward hain , in st ives until work is carried out .
author: Jenny Walrond
Health Correspondent, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: driver trapped after vehicle leaves road , hits lamp-post and crashes into wall
text: a driver was trapped after their vehicle left the road , hit a lamp-post and crashed into a wall , devon and somerset fire and rescue service has said .
the crash happened at about 22:10 in north road , barnstaple and did n't involve any other vehicles .
on person was freed from the vehicle by firefighters and left with paramedics at the scene .
the driver 's condition is unknown .

documents.title: local live in devon and cornwall
text: good morning .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall throughout the day .
if you want to get in touch , please email us
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online
